timeline.message:
[DOCS] [7.6] Update Apple notarization instructions

* Adds a command for notarization security override.
* Changes the Apple support link for the notarization security
  overrides.

timeline.bodyText:
I think this documentation will end up here https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/starting-elasticsearch.html, correct? Perhaps the header of this section could be .macOS Gatekeeper warnings to help clarify it is only for macOS. Also perhaps it should be moved further down the page after where someone would have tried running it.
The popup will not be for an unidentified developer warning, the text will be
"jdk.app" can't be opened because Apple cannot check it for malicious software.

This software needs to be updated. Contact the developer for more information.

Perhaps the line:
If macOS Catalina displays an unidentified developer warning when you first run {es}, you will need to add a security override.

Could be changed to:
If macOS Catalina displays a dialog when you first run {es} that interrupts it, you will need to take an action to allow it to run.

The xattr commands are not adding a security override, they are removing an extended attribute that causes macOS to perform some checks on the file with a tool called Gatekeeper, perhaps the line
To add a security override, run the following command on the downloaded
`.tar.gz` archive or the directory to which was extracted:

Could be:
To prevent Gatekeeper checks on the Elasticsearch files, run the following command on the downloaded
`.tar.gz` archive or the directory to which was extracted:
timeline.author: Conky5
